God of WisdomAnswered on 08 Jun 2019Dude you're way too exposed to just one asset class, property. I'd limit property to about 40% of your entire portfolio which includes your residence.30% Equity
15% Bond
40% Property
5% Cash
5-7% Commodities & Collectibles
3% SpeculationThat's how you should diversify your portfolio for retirement. Slowly shifting more equity into bond and fixed income as you age closer to your 40s, 50s, and 60s.0 comments2

Additionally, does the private property have a high rental yield, or for your own stay?I would look to diversify it further into equities, ETFs, bonds etc.0 comments1
